oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Po' Monkey's Juke Joint: posters
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dillion Rd. near Crosby Rd., Merigold MS

Color photograph of the rough wood siding of the juke building, almost completely covered in posters. Large hand-lettered signs instruct patrons on rules of the establishment. Smaller printed posters are for coming events.

Po' Monkey's juke joint is a documented property on the Mississippi Blues Trail. It is located next to a cotton field on a dirt road in Bolivar County. It was established in 1961 in a building previously used as a sharecropper's shanty, and represents one of the most evocative music heritage properties in the Mississippi Delta.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bars (Drinking establishments)
Barrooms
